name: JAMES WINTER
body:
# JAMES WINTER

212 W 85th ST, Apt 3E, New York, NY 10024  
Home: +1 (212) 741-2263  Cell: +1 (917) 582-2263  
james.winter@yahoo.com  

## CAREER HISTORY

_Mar 2014 – present  _
**Morgan Stanley (New York, NY)  **
**Quality Assurance Manager, Executive Director - Institutional and Corporate Technology  **

Responsible for quality assurance and test execution for the Institutional and Corporate Technology group (ICT).   Duties include management of 50+ test engineers covering all applications in Regulatory, Detailed Sub-ledger (DSL) and General Ledger (GL) from balance and PnL control, federal reporting and posting to General Ledger.  Responsible for all aspects of testing and QA impacting development efforts spanning multiple teams, e.g., implementation of new Detailed Sub-Ledger system, General Ledger renovation from legacy system to SAP, finance reporting and control changes for Supplemental Leverage Ratio, Dodd-Frank, CCAR, BASEL II & III.

Achievements include:  Created dedicated automation team to reduce burden of long regression test cycle.  Significant progress made in reducing most laborious tests down from days to hours to run.  Created dedicated environment management team to offset and reduce dependence on QA team, allowing them to focus fully on testing.

_Jun 2008 – Feb 2014  _
**Bank Of America Merrill Lynch (New York, NY)  **
**Quality Assurance Manager, Vice President - Equity Linked Technology  **

Responsible for quality assurance and test execution for the Equity Linked Technology group (ELT).   Duties include management of 13 test engineers covering all applications in ELT from Pricing, Booking &Deal Capture, Life Cycle, Corp Actions, Market Risk, Model Libraries, PnL, Financial Reporting, Parameter management, and Market data Management. Responsible for QA and project managing wider impacting development efforts spanning multiple teams, e.g., Greeks propagation to leaves for nested Super Baskets, TSE/OSE exchange merger, Russell Rebalance, CSA/OIS Standard Pricing, Structured Notes Pricing, Dodd/Frank regulatory changes, and the expansion of Quartz Risk Platform, which is an integrated, cross-asset, front-to-back position management, pricing, and risk management platform. Managed performance testing of Grid Compute (DataSynapse) in engine pool rebalance from CPUs to GPUs ensuring no degradation for exotic calcs.  Testing migration from DataSynapse to in-house built GridServer (HUGS).

Achievements include:  Consolidating offshore footprint from 3 offshore locations to 2 captive units reducing management overhead.  Ramping up QA team in Toronto to embed resources with near shore development team.  Reduced group costs by retiring QA Lab machines and virtualising to remote virtual desktops. Driving forward proof of concepts with Delphix DB virtualization software to reduce storage costs and dump/load turnaround.  Reduced testing turnaround and stability of environments by segregating the performance stacks from UAT and QA.  Reduced turnaround by automating manual testing activities by employing shell scripting to monitor and kick off batches and monitoring error logs.  Increased testing coverage of Post Trade Batch reporting by increasing team and imbedding 2 resources on shore to kick start effort.  Improved processes across the group by imposing QA sign-off required on all releases or exemptions sort by development.  Implemented a feedback process to ensure Post mortems are carried out and findings published to management for major production incidents.  Metrics and feedback process implemented to find root cause of incidents and drill down on root cause.  Any SDLC incidents remediated so to avoid repeat occurrence.  Implemented metrics capture and trend analysis to warn of trending issues impacting application. Introduced and implemented Agile Scrum/ Test Driven Development methodology into the QA team and continuous integration using Gherkins and SpecFlow/Cucumber.

Jan 2006 – May 2008
UBS Investment Bank (Stamford, CT)
Quality Assurance Manager, Associate Director - Equities IT Derivatives & Equity Linked Technology

Responsible for all quality assurance and testing activities within the Derivatives & Equity Linked product team.   Duties include management of  3 teams (total 12 test engineers) covering Risk Valuation Applications, and Order Management systems for Convertible Bonds and trading system for Structured Instruments.  Responsible for all testing and QA sign off prior to change board approval.  Liaise closely with Quant team, Market Risk Control and Business Risk Control groups to help in running tests for UAT sign off.  Actively manage the QA hardware estate for the group of  140 servers.

Achievements included; Improved communication by moving QA team from Chicago  to Stamford to be imbedded with development team in Stamford.  Use of offshore testing resources in India to give 24/5 testing coverage.  Drastically cut down turn around time for regression tests by use of automation tools and smart result filtering and reporting, allowing more time for investigating differences and test execution.  Expanded automation tool set to cover more applications.  Improved stability of environments by use of VMWare.  Improved accuracy of results by moving to replicated real-time database than snapshot dump and load.

Nov 2000 – Dec 2005
Instinet Corp. Global Agency Brokerage (New York, NY)
Quality Assurance Manager - Post Execution Technology Clearing and Settlements

Employed within the post execution technology area of Instinet servicing the agency broker and ECN business.  Direct responsibility for managing team of 6 QA engineers.  Overall responsibility in thoroughly testing and passing all code subsequent to user acceptance and production release.  Daily tasks included project management, test strategy, test planning, process improvement and metrics gathering activities.  Directly responsible for introducing and implementing the Rational Unified Process (RUP/UML) to improve QA working procedures.  Working closely and building good working relationships with development, release management, customer support and external government organisations, SIAC, ADP, DTC for street wide UAT testing, has been paramount to the successfully completion of two major projects, the Broker Re-architecture and DTC Direct.  Broker re-architecture/migration involved the redesign of the settlement and clearing system to handle increased volumes.  The new system was created using JAVA/J2EE using WEBLOGIC application server, which on any given day handles over 30% of NASDAQ execution volume executed on Instinet/Island ECN.

Jul 2000 – Oct 2000	
Net Exchange (New York, NY)
Quality Assurance Manager - Proprietary Internet Email Messaging/Calendaring System

Ensuring quality in the enterprise style email system designed for small to medium sized businesses.  The system provides email messaging to the entire company with centrally controlled and universally accessible email accounts with full corporate control of accounts through administration module.  Overall responsibility in thoroughly testing and passing all code subsequent to user acceptance and production release.

Duties include managing and mentoring team of 4 testers, managing code promotion to the QA environment, managing error logging and defect tracking using workflow tool TeamTrack, test plan creation and test execution, introduction of QA release and sign-off procedures, and test tool evaluation RSW eTester and eLoad.  Testing activities include the testing of the SMTP and POP3 email servers ensuring adherence to the open Internet standards RFC821 and 822.  

Nov 1999 – Jun 2000
Interim Technology Consulting (New York, NY)
Senior Software Quality Management Consultant - Citibank CityDirect World Link Project

Involved in testing Citibank’s CityDirect online banking system, allowing access to Payments/FX/Netting/File Transfer functions for corporate customers, with specific focus on File Transmission a multi-currency payment system using a file transmission method for both the import/export of payment/statement data.  Tasks include test plan creation and test execution, QC metrics reporting, test data creation, defect tracking using TeamTrack and automated script running and creation using WinRunner.

Nov 1997 – Oct 1999
Electronic Data Systems (Canary Wharf, London and World Trade Centre, New York, NY)
Senior Quality Assurance Team Lead
Credit Suisse First Boston, NY Back Office Banking Systems, Financial/Product Control & Emerging Markets, End User Computing Y2K Compliance Project

Involved in the year 2000 effort for end user applications for CSFB Financial Control/Product Control and Emerging Markets group.  Responsibilities include managing a team of three analysts in assessment/remediation/testing and sign-off of MS Excel spreadsheet and MS Access database applications integrating with front and back office systems.  Work was complete to standards and deadlines set down by the regional programme office.
 
Also responsible for coordinating the Year 2000 testing activities for CSNY back office banking systems, including Precious Metals, Money Markets, Demand Deposit Accounting, Global Limits Risk, Trade Finance and Commercial Loans. These were running on a mixture of VAX and client/server architecture.  Tasks included leading a team of 4 testers, developing Y2K testing strategy, planning work and testing schedules, designing and implementing error logging and reporting MS Access database, writing regression and Y2K test plans, executing tests, verifying/documenting results, and evaluation of automated test tools.

Jan 1995 – Oct 1997
Citymax Integrated Information Systems (Canary Wharf, London)
Senior Systems Tester
London Stock Exchange, ‘Arrow CREST/GILTS’ Securities & Bonds Settlement System (Jan.96-Oct.97)

Tasks include functionality/volume and regression testing, writing system test plans, management and set-up of test environments and writing customer installation guides.  Approximately 20% of regression testing achieved using QA Run automated testing tool and using QA Partner.  Wholly responsible for developing/running a suite of data driven automated test scripts by reading test data from excel spreadsheets and checking against oracle database using SQLPlus. The work was carried out in a highly pressured banking/broking environment, testing to strict deadlines laid down by CREST Co., Central Gilts Office and the Bank of England.

Analyst Programmer
Brokermax Securities Brokerage System (Jan 95-Dec95)

Involved in the development and support of Brokermax, using VMS/VAX BASIC. Work comprised of medium sized projects of 10 to 50 man days. Experience in all areas of the development life cycle, i.e., producing customer quotes, risk assessment, writing program specifications, test plans, coding, testing, implementation, configuration management and delivery strategy.  This led to good exposure of the system including Capital Gains Tax, Trade capture/settlement, Private Client Package, Bulk Settlement and Portfolio Valuations.  All work was undertaken in accordance with the quality management system accredited to ISO9000.


## EDUCATION

1989 - 1993	University Of Central England (Birmingham)
Qualification:	B.Sc. Hons Export Engineering
Main subjects:	Information Technology, Business Studies, Engineering
Dissertation:	Investigating The Problems And Opportunities Of International Branding (First)

1987 - 1989	Queen Elizabeth Sixth Form College (Darlington)
Qualification:	2 A' levels - Geology, Chemistry

1982 - 1987	Carmel Comprehensive School (Darlington)
Qualification:	9 O' levels - incl. English, Maths & Computer Science


## REFEREES		Provided on request.
